page.title: 10St Annes - Local News
page.content: Tory Controlled Fylde Borough Council more popular than 1981 when it lost all seats in Lytham St Annes when voters rebelled against decades of stagnation and inaction. June 13th. Campaign launched against St Annes flat 'sharks'.Officers inspecting hundreds of houses in mul- tiple occupation as flats and bedsits. Hundreds believed to live without all washing,toilet and heating facilities, no fire escape or food storage room. Landlords ordered to improve property eligible for grants up to Â£10,000. Rents for some of the flats between Â£20 & Â£40 a week.Plans for fiesta- style shopping to brighten shopping and promote area under discussion by resort's Chamber of Trade and Commerce British Aerospace Warton to shed part of workforce in early retirement scheme. Union anger.
